subject: Law
title: Fair Use Doctrine
description: A short lesson to help you apply Fair Use Doctrine.

hook.text: A comedian parodies a hit song. The songwriter sues. The comedian winsâ€”it's fair use.

buildup.text: Fair use allows limited use of copyrighted material without permission for purposes like criticism and education.

discovery.text: Courts weigh four factors: purpose of use, nature of the work, amount used, and market impact.

twist.text: No bright-line rule exists. Fair use is decided case by case, making it the most unpredictable area of copyright law.

climax.text: Google's use of Java APIs in Android was ruled fair use by the Supreme Court after a decade-long legal battle.

punchline.text: Fair use is a defense, not a right. You argue it after you're sued.

quiz.question: How many factors do courts consider in fair use analysis?
